name: Another Dose of Doggerel Quiz | Animals | 10 Questions

questions.text: The American pit bull terrier was originally bred as a guard dog.
questions.explanation:
False.

	They were bred from the English version of the breed, which was originally used to fight bulls. When this was banned, the dogs were used to fight other dogs. Because the owners were in the pit along with the dogs, handling them, human-aggressive animals were not tolerated. This barbaric practice continues but unofficially.

questions.text: Because of their great intelligence, border collies make excellent pets for "couch potatoes".
questions.explanation:
False.

	These bright and active dogs need a job to do or they will become neurotic and obsessive. They need a lot of work every day to be happy. Most are miserable if they just 'hang around the house.'

questions.text: Most adult dogs have dental disease.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Over 80 percent of adult dogs have noticeable dental disease. Gingivitis is the most common.

questions.text: The most common dental disease in dogs is cavities.
questions.explanation:
False.

	It's actually gum inflammation caused by tartar accumulation. The infected gums can send bacteria into the bloodstream, causing many problems.

questions.text: Standard poodles can make good hunting dogs.
questions.explanation:
True.

	They were originally bred as water retrievers. Given a chance, they can still do their original job.

questions.text: Most short-tailed dogs, like cocker spaniels, Doberman pinschers, Jack Russell terriers and Rottweilers, are born with short tails.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The tails are actually cut off of the very young puppies. This practice, known as 'docking', is illegal in some European countries.

questions.text: In twentieth century United States, most dogs turned in to animal shelters and pounds were adopted.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Unfortunately, the majority were killed - 'put to sleep.' The balance is changing a little, as the public becomes more accustomed to the idea of adopting older dogs.

questions.text: The Great Dane was originally bred in Denmark.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The breed comes from Germany, where it is known as the German mastiff, or Deutsche dogge. The French name is Dogue Allemand.

questions.text: A dog with a wagging tail is always happy.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Different tail positions signify different meanings for the wag. A nervous dog will hold the tail low and wag just the tip. An aggressive dog will have a high-standing, slowly-wagging tail.

questions.text: Dogs yawn because they are bored.
questions.explanation:
False.

	In reality, yawning in dogs is usually a sign of nervousness.
